description: a(n) is the greatest prime factor of a(n-2)*a(n-1)-1.
links: Sami Liedes, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..34
maple: with(numtheory):a:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n<2, n+2,      max(factorset(a(n-2)*a(n-1)-1)[]))    end:seq(a(n), n=0..22);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 03 2014
mathematica: a[0] = 2; a[1] = 3; a[n_] := a[n] = FactorInteger[ a[n-2]*a[n-1] - 1][[-1, 1]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 21}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Mar 09 2012 *)nxt[{a_,b_}]:={b,FactorInteger[a*b-1][[-1,1]]}; Transpose[NestList[nxt,{2,3},25]][[1]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 05 2014 *)
prog: (PARI) A034970(a,b) = {local(f);f=factor(a*b-1);f[matsize(f)[1],1]}a=2;b=3;print(a);print(b)for(n=2,28,c=A034970(a,b);print(c);a=b;b=c)(Haskell)a034970 n = a034970_list !! na034970_list = 2 : 3 : (map (a006530 . (subtract 1)) $                        zipWith (*) a034970_list $ tail a034970_list)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 23 2012
author: _Erich Friedman_.
